intro: [WRONG START] Macleodium ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic macleod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
